Хорошая игра, великий мод на Half-Life, на одном же уровне, что и Counter-Strike, только, к сожалению, эта игра любима была лишь в те времена, сейчас же, в неё почти никто не играет. 

Не советую тратить на неё деньги, потому что сейчас есть Team Fortress 2, и Fortress Forever, но это уже ваше личное мнение.

I really enjoy this game! Now if you come from other FPS games you might not understand what to do in your first couple of matches. But thats okay! This game is very different from TF2 even though it's the same franchise. It still has character classes and unique weapons though. But this game is a lot faster paced than TF2. Sometimes its hard to know whats going on due to so much explosions!But once you find a class you like, you will become amazing. This game is very fun and addictive. I think there should be more players!

Buttermilk Cornbread

INGREDIENTS:
1 1/2 cups cornmeal
1 cup all-purpose flour
1/3 cup sugar
4 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon kosher salt
2 cups buttermilk
1 large egg
6 tablespoons unsalted butter, melted and divided
DIRECTIONS:
Preheat oven to 425 degrees F. Place an oven-proof 10-inch cast iron skillet in the oven.
In a large bowl, combine cornmeal, flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.
In a large glass measuring cup or another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, egg and 3 tablespoons butter. Pour mixture over dry ingredients and stir using a rubber spatula just until moist.

Remove skillet from the oven and add remaining 3 tablespoons until heated through, about 1-2 minutes.
Working carefully, immediately scoop the batter into the hot skillet. Place into oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until a tester inserted in the center comes out clean. Let cool 5 minutes.
Serve warm.

The game mechanics being very close to TF2, I recommend you just read my review on that one instead. This game is essentially a nostalgic kick for the people who've been playing it back in the day.

If I'd have to give the game a real rating, I'd say a 4/10. The game itself is a 1 by today's standards, being clunky at all, but it made TF2 possible, which is a staple in the FPS-genre.

Where it all began.
Obviously, It's outdated, but It's pretty fun for a game from years ago.
I might as well keep playing. >:3

This game is better than you think. Just be warned that the mechanics are very different. However, this is a good use of 5 dollars.

The Underrated Team Fortress game. Sure I think it's pretty well known TF2 is far and away better but that doesn't mean this game isn't worth playing. With the same basic game play as it's prodigal son and with that charm of Gold Source, it's definitely worth a shot.

Pretty fun game. Gunplay is fun for a gold source game. Player clipping is both fun and annoying since you can boost teammates; however getting in other players way can feel wonky. Grenades are very good so much so that there's no reason not to spam them like crazy in every scenario. I like that there are no random elements, bhopping feels good to pull off and no unlocks keeps gameplay consistant. My biggest issue is lack of players and servers but that's to be expected from an older game.

The first team fortress game. Overall it is a good game and can still be played with people on the right times and on the right days. This should come to no surprise but there is no way to play this game offline (officially.) People still play the game and if you want to see what the original team fortress game was like then it could be a fun time.
